ThermalSolutionCartHarmonic

class pyrit.solution.ThermalSolutionCartHarmonic(description: str, solution: ndarray, mesh: Mesh, shape_function: ShapeFunction, regions: Regions, materials: Materials, excitations: Excitations, frequency: float)

Bases: HarmonicSolution

The solution of a two-dimensional, harmonic heat conduction problem in Cartesian coordinates.

The corresponding problem class is ThermalProblemCartHarmonic.

A general, harmonic solution.

Parameters

  • description (str) – A description of the solution.

  • solution (np.ndarray) – The solution.

  • mesh (Mesh) – A mesh object. See pyrit.mesh.

  • shape_function (ShapeFunction) – A shape function object. See pyrit.shapefunction.

  • regions (Regions) – A regions object. See pyrit.regions.

  • materials (Materials) – A materials object. See pyrit.materials.

  • excitations (Excitations) – An excitations object. See pyrit.excitation.

  • frequency (float) – The frequency of the solution.

property frequency: float

static get_field_at_phase(frequency: float, field: ndarray, phase: float = 0, time: Optional[float] = None)

Evaluate the complex valued field at a certain phase.

Each entry in field is a complex number, representing a phasor. Return the field at a certain phase, or for a certain time point. Let \(\varphi\) be the phase and \(\underline{g}\) be a complex value. Then the formula is

\[g = \Re\left\{\underline{g} e^{\jmath\varphi}\right\}\,.\]

If the time \(t\) is given, the phase is determined by \(\varphi = 2\pi f t\), where \(f\) is the frequency.

Parameters

  • frequency (float) – The frequency of the field.

  • field (np.ndarray) – The field.

  • phase (float, optional) – The phase. Default is 0

  • time (float, optional) – The time. Default is None

Returns

field_at_phase – Field at the specified phase or time.

Return type

np.ndarray

ignore_for_saving = []

List of attributes that are not saved

initialize_attributes()

Initialize the protected attributes needed for the properties.

static load(path: Union[str, Path]) → Solution

Load a solution.

Parameters

path (Union[str, Path]) – The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information.

Returns

solution – A solution instance.

Return type

Solution

property omega: float

The angular frequency.

save(path: Union[str, Path], ignore_attributes: Optional[List[str]] = None) → Path

Saves the solution instance.

Parameters

  • path (Union[str, Path]) –

    The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information. If the path contains a non-existing folder, this folder will be created.

  • ignore_attributes (List[str], optional) – A list of attributes that are not included in the saved file. The default value is ignore_for_saving of the object.

Returns

path – The path that was used for opening the file.

Return type

Path

  • problem (HarmonicProblem) – A static problem.

  • solution (np.ndarray) – The solution of the harmonic problem.

Returns
